Articles.Content:
It appears that if you do some science, say observe Mystery Goo or take a crew report, then revert and attempt to re-do the same science you get fewer points for it. For example if it was originally a high value experiment it will be lower, if you revert enough it will be zero. I thought it might work itself out when you completed the mission, but it does not.

There is an old thread about this same issue here:

[http://steamcommunity.com/app/220200/discussions/0/648814842000453371/](http://steamcommunity.com/app/220200/discussions/0/648814842000453371/)

The link at the end no longer works.

This doesn't seem right since revert reverts everything else...

Thanks

Kerbal Space Program - 1.0.4.861 (WindowsPlayer) Steam

OS: Windows 7 Service Pack 1 (6.1.7601) 64bit

CPU: AMD Phenom II X6 1090T Processor (6)

RAM: 8189

GPU: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 560 Ti (977MB)

SM: 30 (Direct3D 9.0c [nvd3dum.dll 9.18.13.4411])

RT Formats: ARGB32, Depth, ARGBHalf, RGB565, Default, DefaultHDR, ARGBFloat, RGFloat, RGHalf, RFloat, RHalf, R8

Stock install, no mods.
